# eslint/no-unused-expressions <Badge type="info" text="Restriction" />

<div class="rule-meta">
</div>

### What it does

This rule disallows unused expressions.

### Why is this bad?

Unused expressions are usually a mistake. They can be a symptom of a bug or a misunderstanding of the code.

### Examples

Examples of **incorrect** code for this rule:

```ts
Set<number>;
1 as number;
window!;
```

Examples of **correct** code for this rule:

```ts
const foo = new Set<number>();
```

- [Rule Source](https://github.com/oxc-project/oxc/blob/2b14a6fb5403dfe5eff8dfade3baf7725b837052/crates/oxc_linter/src/rules/eslint/no_unused_expressions.rs)
